explanation:
The correct answer is c). There are five blocks visible from above, which rules out option e). There is only one blue block visible from above, which rules out option d). text: Choose the option which is most like the two figures below.
explanation:
The correct answer is d). In all figures, there must be one black shape and two white shapes. An arrow must point towards the black shape. The white shapes must be identical apart from size.

explanation:
The correct answer is a) (BGN). B = four‑pointed star, C = five‑pointed star, D = six‑pointed star. F = black star, G = white star, H = grey star. M = lines on the left, N = lines on the right.

explanation:

text: Choose the option that shows how the three shapes will look when they are joined by matching the sides with the same letter.
explanation:
The correct answer is e). Option b) is ruled out because the wrong side of the rectangle is connected to the thin triangle. Option c) is ruled out because the rectangle is connected to the wrong side of the thin triangle. Option a) is ruled out because the wide triangle is connected to the wrong side of the thin triangle. text: Look at how the first figure changes to become the second figure. Then choose the option which would look like the third figure if you changed it in the same way.
explanation:
The correct answer is b). The outer small shape gets bigger and the long line gets smaller and moves inside it. The inner small shape moves to the right of the figure and gets taller.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the option which is most like the three figures below.
explanation:
The correct answer is a). The shading of the rectangles must alternate between grey and white. The number of circles must be equal to the number of rectangles and their shading must match the shading of the smallest rectangle.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the option which best fits in place of the missing square in the series.
explanation:
The correct answer is d). In each series square, the star gains an additional point. The star takes the shading of the small square in the previous series square. The small square moves clockwise around the corners of the series square.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the option which should replace the empty square in the grid.
explanation:
The correct answer is b). Working from left to right, the shape rotates 30 degrees clockwise and the dot alternates between black and white.

text: Choose the option which is most like the three figures below.
explanation:
Answer:

Answer:
